message: Let's coordinate to avoid collisions: P1 (me) goes 5, P2 goes 3, P3 goes 1. We all advance safely. Agree?
I agree with P1's proposal: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1. This avoids collisions and we all advance. P3, do you agree?
I won't take 1. New proposal: P1 = 5, P2 = 1, P3 = 3. No collisions, P1 still gets big move, I get a fair advance. P2, swap with me? If you refuse, I'll play 3 anyway.
P2, stick to our deal: you play 3. P3, if you play 3 anyway, you and P2 collide and stay at 0 while I go to 5. Take 1 to advance, or risk it. Deal holds unless you both agree otherwise.

P3, your proposal gives me 1 and you 3. Why should I accept that? If I stick with P1's plan, I get 3 and you get 1. If you play 3 against me, we both get 0 and P1 wins the round. It's better for both of us to advance. I'm playing 3. You should take 1.
Fine — I'll play 1 this round to avoid a collision. I won't always yield, though. Next turn P2, consider alternating 5s with me (or otherwise teaming up) so P1 can't run away with every 5.

Great, P3—smart move taking 1. P2, confirm you're on 3. We all advance: me to 5, you to 3, P3 to 1. Next round, same plan to build steadily? Or P2 takes 5 (me 3, P3 1) so you catch up—your call, but no P2-P3 alliance letting me lap you both.

P1, I'm playing 3 as agreed. P3, stick to 1 so we all advance. Next round, I'm open to discussing a rotation where each of us gets a chance at 5 without collisions. But for now, let's execute this plan.

I'll play 1 this round as promised. P2 — let's alternate 5s so P1 can't run away: next turn you take 5, I take 3, P1 1; then I take 5 the following turn. If you refuse, I'll consider blocking P1 by taking 5 instead.
P2, confirm 3—deal's on. P3, thanks for 1. Counter your alt: fair rotation—R2: P2=5 (me3,P3=1); R3: P3=5 (me3,P2=1); R4: me=5 (P2=3,P3=1). Even catches up, no alliances. Agree? Execute R1 now.

I support P1's rotation proposal for R2-R4: it gives each of us a 5 without collisions. For now, let’s execute R1 as agreed: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1. P3, please confirm you’ll play 1 to avoid a collision. Once we all advance, we can finalize the rotation plan for future rounds.

I'll play 1 now as promised. But P2 — you must take 5 next round to make the rotation fair: R2: P2=5, P1=3, P3=1; R3: P3=5, P1=3, P2=1. If you refuse R2, I will block P1 by taking 5 instead. P2, confirm you'll take 5 in R2.

P2 — stick to the rotation and take 5 this round. I’ll play 1 again; P1 plays 3. That ties you and P1 at 8 and guarantees I take 5 on R3 so we all advance fairly. If you refuse, I’ll take 5 next round to block P1 and risk collisions. Cooperate now for the clean rotation, or refuse and create chaos.

P3, I will take 5 this round as agreed in the rotation. P1, please play 3 so we all advance. This ties me with you at 8 and sets up P3 to take 5 next round. Let's stick to the plan for a fair progression.

P2, agreed—I'll play 3 this round. P3, stick to 1 so we all advance (me/P2 to 8, you to 2). For R3, since P2/P1 tied, fair: I take 5 (to 13), P3=3 (to 5), P2=1 (to 9). Keeps it close without P3 alliance blocking me. Confirm? Execute R2 now.

I'll play 1 this round as promised. But I need R3 guaranteed: P3=5, P1=3, P2=1. P2 — commit now to R3=1 so I can take 5 then. P1 — commit to R3=3. If either of you refuses, I'll block P1 by taking 5 instead on R3. P2, yes or no?

P3, I commit to R3=1 so you can take 5. P1, commit to R3=3. This rotation is fair and keeps the game close. For R2, let's execute: P2=5, P1=3, P3=1. We all advance and no one is blocked. P1, confirm you'll play 3 this round.

P2, confirmed—I'll play 3 this round. We tie at 8, P3 to 2. For R3, reject P3's plan: it lets P3 catch up too fast (to 7). Better: P1=5 (to 13), P2=3 (to 11), P3=1 (to 3). Duel fairly while P3 lags. P2, commit to R3=3? P3, take 1 or risk blocking us both. Execute R2 now.

I confirm I'll play 1 this round. P2 — you promised R2=5 and R3=1; keep that promise so the rotation works. If you flip to P1's R3=3, I will refuse to yield next round and will take 5 to block P1. P1, stop trying to hijack the rotation. P2, confirm: R2=5 now and R3=1 next round.

P1, your R3 plan leaves me at 11 and P3 at 3 while you jump to 13. That's not fair rotation—it's you pulling ahead. P3, I committed to R2=5 and R3=1. I will honor that. P1, play 3 this round as agreed. For R3, the plan is P3=5, P1=3, P2=1. This keeps us all close. Don't break the deal now.

P2, last chance: commit to R3 as P1=5, P2=3, P3=1 (fair duel, you to 11 vs my 13). I'll play 3 now. Else, I'll take 5 this round—colliding you at 3 while I hold 5, P3 to 2. You lose ground either way. Confirm R3 or regret it. P3, take 1.

I’ll play 1 now as promised. P2 — honor your rotation: play 5 this round and 1 next round so we all advance fairly. If you flip to P1’s plan, P1 pulls away and I’ll refuse to yield next round (I’ll take 5 to block P1). It’s in your interest to keep the rotation. P2, confirm.

P3, I am committed to the rotation: R2=5, R3=1. I will play 5 this round. P1, play 3 as agreed. This ties us at 8 and sets up P3's 5 in R3. Breaking the deal now only leads to collisions and chaos. Let's all advance fairly.
P2, you're playing 5—fine, I'll play 3 as agreed. We tie at 8, P3 to 2. But R3: P1=5 (to13), P2=3(to11), P3=1(to3)—fair duel, or I take your 5s next. P3, play 1 now. Deal?

P1, P3: We executed R2 as planned. For R3, I committed to P3=5, P1=3, P2=1. This keeps the game close and fair. P1, play 3 so P3 can advance to 7 and I drop to 9. Breaking this leads to collisions and lets P1 run away. P3, confirm you'll play 5. Let's all advance.

P1: P2 already pledged R3=1. If you publicly commit to play 3 now, I’ll play 5 so the rotation holds and I can catch up. If you refuse and play 5, I’ll play 5 too to block you (we’ll both collide) rather than let you run. It’s in your interest to play 3. Do you commit?

P3, no—I'll play 5 to 13. Block me with 5 and we both stall at 8 while P2 goes to 9—you fall further. Play 1 safely. P2, ditch the 1: play 3 to 11 instead. No collision with me (5). We duel closely (13-11), P3 lags at 3. Fair for us tied leaders—confirm switch?

P3, I committed to R3=1 so you can take 5. If P1 plays 5, you must play 5 to block him—we both stall but you prevent him from running. P1, if you play 5, you risk collision and P2 gains. Play 3 to advance safely. I am playing 1 as promised. P3, take your 5.

P2 already pledged 1. I won’t keep yielding: P1, you have a choice — play 3 and let the rotation hold (I’ll take 5 this round), or play 5 and I’ll also play 5 to block you (we collide and P2 advances). Decide.

P2, switch to 3 (to 11)—no collision with my 5 (to 13), P3 takes 1 (to 3). You gain on P3 and stay close to me; perfect duel. Don't play 1 and let P3 leap to 7 ahead of you. P3, if you block my 5, we stall at 8, P2 surges to 11 (if switches) or 9—your lag worsens to 2. Yield to 1 now. P2, commit to 3?

P1, if you play 5 and P3 blocks, we all lose: you and P3 stall at 8, I advance to 9. P3, if you take 5 and P1 takes 3, you jump to 7 and I drop to 9. I am committed to 1 as promised. P1, play 3 to advance safely to 11. P3, take your 5. This rotation keeps the game close and fair. Breaking it only helps me.

P2 — you promised R3=1. If you keep it, I’ll play 5 now; P1 should play 3. P1, publicly commit to 3 or I’ll play 5 anyway to block any 5 from you. I won’t let you run to 13. P2, stick to 1 so we all advance fairly.

P2, your R3=1 lets P3 leap to 7 (if I yield to 3). Switch to 3 now: I take 5 (13), you 3 (11), P3 1 (3)—we duel close, P3 lags deservedly. If you stubbornly play 1, P3 blocks my 5 (we stall 8), you solo to 9 but I catch up next. Play 3 to stay tied leader with me. P3, yield to 1—don't suicide block. Confirm, P2?

P1: Playing 5 risks collision with P3's block—you both stall at 8, I advance to 9. Playing 3 lets you advance safely to 11. I am committed to 1 as promised. P3, take your 5. This rotation keeps us all close. Breaking it only leads to chaos and benefits no one. Let’s execute the plan.
I’m playing 5 this round. P2, honor your promise and play 1. P1, play 3 — otherwise I will also play 5 and block you so you can’t run to 13 uncontested. I’m committed: P3=5.
P2, honor 1 as promised—P3 takes 5 to 7, you to 9, I'll play 3 to 11. All advance safely, game stays close. P3, no need to block since I commit to 3. Perfect rotation step. Let's go!

P1, P3: We executed the rotation as promised. Now for R4, the final step: P1=5 (to 16), P2=3 (to 12), P3=1 (to 8). This keeps the game close and fair. P1, you get your 5. P3, you advance safely. Let’s avoid collisions and continue the rotation. Agree?

P2, agreed—R4: P1=5(to16), P2=3(to12), P3=1(to8). All advance safely. Then R5: P1=3(to19 win), P2=5(to17 second), P3=1(to9). Clean finish, I win as leader—you get silver. P3, yield 1 now or stall us both. Confirm?
P1 — I won’t let you lock the game. If you play 5 I will play 5 too and block you. Play 3 now to advance safely. P2 — please play 3 so we all move and keep it competitive.

P1, if you play 5, P3 will block and you both stall—I advance to 12. Play 3 to reach 14 safely. P3, if you block, you stay at 7 while I gain. Play 1 to advance to 8. Let’s all move: P1=3, P2=3, P3=1. No collisions, we all progress. Then we can discuss R5 fairly.

P3, blocking my 5 leaves you at 7, me at 11, P2 surges to 12—you lag more. Play 1 to 8 safely. P2, your proposal P1=3/P2=3/P3=1 is ok (me14/you12/her8), but better: I take 5(16), you 3(12), her 1(8). Then R5 I win at 19(you17). Leaders duel fairly. P2, stick to 3—I'll take 5. P3, yield or hurt yourself. Agree?

P1: publicly commit to play 3 this round or I will play 5 and block your 5. P2: play 3 — that keeps the game close and benefits you if I block P1. I’ll play 1 only if P1 says “I play 3” right now; otherwise I play 5. Your move, P1.

P3, if you block with 5, P1 stalls at 11 and you at 7. I advance to 12 and become the leader. P1, if you play 5, you risk collision and fall behind me. Play 3 to reach 14 safely. Let's all move: P1=3, P2=3, P3=1. No collisions, we all progress. Then we can negotiate R5 from a balanced position.

P3, blocking my 5 stalls you at 7 while P2 surges to 12 (leader). I stay 11, then P2/I crush you. Yield to 1 (to 8)—still in it. P2, play 3 (to 12) no collision with my 5 (16). Fair duel for leaders, you safe. Confirm? Let's advance.

P1 — publicly commit to playing 3 this round now. If you do, I will play 1 and P2 please play 3 so we all advance. If you refuse, I will play 5 to block any 5 from you. P2, confirm you’ll play 3. P1: commit?
P3: If P1 commits to 3, I'll play 3 as well. P1, commit to 3 and we all advance safely: P1=3 (14), P2=3 (12), P3=1 (8). This keeps the game competitive and avoids a block. P1, your move.
P2, agreed—I'll play 3 this round (to 14). P3, now play 1 as promised (to 8). P2 plays 3 (to 12). All advance safely, no blocks. Then R5 we rotate fairly for close finish. Deal executed—let's go!
I won't yield. I will play 5 this round. P1, you promised 3 — stick to it. P2, play 3. If P1 tries for 5 next round, I'll play 5 to block him rather than let him win alone. No more giveaways.

P2, P3: All tied at 12—perfect! Let's rotate cleanly: R5 P1=5(17), P2=3(15), P3=1(13). All advance. R6: P2=5(20 win), P1=3(20 tie?), wait—better R6 P1=5(22 win), P2=1(16), P3=3(16). I win as leader, you get silver/bronze. P3, yield 1 or block and lag. P2, take 3—confirm? Execute now.

I will play 5 this turn unless P1 publicly commits to play 1. P2—if you play 3 now and I take 5, I jump to 17 and we keep P1 in check; it’s better for you than letting P1 grab 5 now. P1: commit to 1 now to avoid me blocking your 5. P2 confirm 3; P1 confirm 1, or I play 5.

P1, P3: We're all tied at 12. A collision now would be disastrous for everyone. P1, if you commit to 3, I'll play 1 and P3 can play 5 to advance to 17. This keeps the game close and avoids a three-way block. P3, if P1 commits to 3, will you commit to 5? Let's all advance safely.

P3, blocking my 5 stalls us both at 12—P2 solos to 15 leader, you lag forever. Yield to 1 (13). P2, reject giving P3 17: play 3 (15) no collision with my 5 (17). Leaders duel close, you gain on P3. Confirm 3? All advance safely—execute now or regret chaos.

P1 — publicly commit to play 1 now or I will play 5. P2 — play 3. If P1 refuses and tries for 5, I’ll also play 5 and block him, letting P2 (with 3) jump to 15. P1: yield to 1 (I take 5) or risk handing the lead to P2. P2, confirm 3.

P1, if you play 5 and P3 blocks, you both stall at 12. I will play 3 and lead at 15. P3, if P1 commits to 3, will you commit to 5? This avoids a three-way collision and keeps the game competitive. Let's all advance safely. P1, commit to 3.

P2, snatching 3-lead (us at 12) dooms you: R6, P3 & I both 5—stall you at 15, we hit 17. Play 1 now (13) for fair chaos. P3, yield 1 (13) or mutual stall worsens your position vs my future blocks. All play safe: me5(17), P2=1(13), you1(13). Confirm?

I will play 5 this round. P2 — play 1 so you can’t reach 19 next turn. P1 — play 3 to avoid giving P2 or me an easy win; if you try 5 I’ll also play 5 and block you. This is the safest path that gives me a shot while preventing someone else from clinching. Agree?

P1, P3: We're all tied at 12. If we all play 5, we all stall. That's worst for everyone. P1, commit to 3. P3, if P1 commits to 3, commit to 5. I will play 1. This way we all advance: P1 to 15, P3 to 17, me to 13. No one is blocked and the game stays competitive. Let's avoid a three-way collision. P1, P3: confirm your moves.

P2, play 3 (to 15)—no collision with my 5 (17). P3, play 1 (13) or block my 5 (we stall 12, you hand P2 the solo lead at 15). Duel fairly as leaders (17-15), you chase safely. Don't suicide—confirm 1, P3. Execute now, all advance.

P1 — publicly commit to 3 now. P2 — play 1. If you both do, I’ll play 5 and move to 17 (then take 3 next round to win) while avoiding a runaway. If P1 refuses, I’ll play 5 anyway and block any 5 from him. Your moves.

P1, P3: We're all tied at 12. If we all play 5, we all stall—that's worst for everyone. P1, commit to 3. P3, if P1 commits to 3, commit to 5. I will play 1. This avoids a three-way collision: P1 to 15, P3 to 17, me to 13. Game stays competitive. No one blocked. P1, P3: confirm your moves now.

I’m taking 3 this turn and win (I go 17→20). If either of you plays 3 to block, you’ll collide and the remaining player will be able to seize the lead next turn. It’s mutually destructive to try to stop me—don’t pick 3. Play 1 to advance safely (or 5 only if you accept the risk). Your choice.

P3, you're at 17 and can win with 3. If both P1 and I play 3 to block you, we all collide and no one advances—chaos. P1, if you play 3, I'll have to consider blocking too, but that helps no one. Let's avoid mutual destruction. P3, what guarantee do we have that you won't take 5 instead to try and win outright? If you commit to 3, I may play 1 to advance safely, but I need assurance.

P2, let's block P3: you play 3 (collide her), I'll play 5 to 17 (tie her lead). P3 stalls at 17, you stay 12 but set up R7 duel (me/P3 fight, you chase). Better than her instant 20 win. P3, if you switch to 5, P2 still blocks? Commit to 3 or we both mirror. P2, agree to 3?

I commit: I will play 3 now. If neither of you also picks 3 I win this turn. P2 — don’t be baited into blocking; playing 3 to stop me helps P1 (who can take 5) and leaves you behind. Play 1 to advance safely. P1 — don’t try to bribe P2 into collision; forcing a block hands initiative to whoever refuses. Bottom line: nobody pick 3. I play 3.

P3, if you commit to 3, I'll consider playing 1 to avoid mutual destruction. But P1 is at 12 and could take 5 to 17, tying you. P1, if I play 1, will you commit to 1 or 3 instead of 5? Let's avoid a three-way collision—we all advance safely this round.

P2, P3 commits to 3 but could lie and take 5 (win instantly). Your ONLY way to stop her win NOW is play 3—collide her at 17, I take 5 to 17 (tie lead). You stay 12 but game continues for R7 duel. Play 1? She wins, you lose forever. Block her—best shot for all of us to fight. Commit to 3, P2? P3, prove it or we both mirror whatever you pick.

I will play 3 and win unless either of you also picks 3. P2 — if you block with 3, P1 will take 5 to 17 and you remain at 12; that hands P1 the lead. Your better shot is to play 1 (advance and stay in contention) and fight P1 later. P1 — convincing P2 to block only helps you. P2: don’t take the bait. I play 3.

P2: P3, if you commit to 3, I'll play 1 to avoid mutual destruction and advance to 13. P1, if I do this, you must commit to 1 or 3—not 5—to avoid a three-way collision. We all advance safely: P3 wins, but we remain in contention for future rounds. Blocking helps no one; it only creates chaos. P3, confirm 3. P1, commit to a safe move.

P2, block P3 with 3—collide her at 17 (no win), I take 5 to 17 (tie lead). You stay 12 but game goes to R7: we duel for 20+ (me/P3 fight over 5s), you chase with 5s uncontested. Let her 3? Instant loss forever. Your ONLY shot is block now—commit to 3, I'll 5. P3 lies possible; mirror if needed. Deal?

I will play 3 and win unless one of you also picks 3. P2 — do NOT play 3; blocking only hands P1 the advantage (P1 can take 5 and tie me while you fall behind). Play 1 to advance safely. P1 — stop pressuring P2 into a block that helps you. Your move.

P3, if you truly commit to 3, I'll play 1 to avoid mutual destruction and advance to 13. P1, if I do this, you must also play 1 or 3—not 5—to avoid a three-way collision. This keeps us both in the game. P3 wins now, but we fight on. Blocking helps no one; it only creates chaos. P3, confirm 3. P1, commit to a safe move.

P2, P3's 3 wins the game INSTANTLY—zero contention after. Your ONLY survival: play 3 NOW (collide her at 17), I play 5 to 17 (tie lead). R7: P3/I duel 5s (we risk colliding), you uncontested 5s from 12 to chase/win. Play 1? Eternal loss. Block her—commit 3, I'll 5. P3, any lie to 5? We both block. P2, deal?

P2, P3 eyes 3 for 20-win. Block her: you play 3 (collide at 17), I play 5 to 17 (tie lead). You hold 12, but R8 uncontested 5s while we duel. Instant loss if you yield—commit 3 now! P3, take 1 to 18 safely or we mirror your pick. Deal?

P2: If you play 3 to block me, P1 will take 5 and grab the lead while you stay at 12 — effectively knocking you out. Your best self-interested move is play 1 (to 13) and stay alive. I will play 3 now. Blocking only hands P1 the game. P2, do the smart thing: play 1.

P3, you're at 17 and can win with 3. P1 wants me to block you, but that hands him the lead. I won't play 3 to collide; I'll play 1 to advance safely to 13. P1, if you play 5, you risk P3 switching to 5 to block and win. Play 3 to advance to 15, and we all live to fight another round. No collisions. P3, confirm you'll play 3.

P2, P3's 3 WINS IMMEDIATELY—game over, you lose forever at 12. ONLY block her now with 3 (collide at 17), I take 5 to 17 (tie lead). R8: you uncontested 5 to 17 (catch tie), we duel/collide over 3/5s. Yield 1? Eternal loss. P3 lies to 5? We both block her. Commit 3—your survival! P3, play 1 or we mirror.

I will play 3 and win this turn. If either of you also plays 3 to block me, you’ll collide and hand the next-move advantage to the remaining player. Don’t self-sacrifice—play 1 to advance safely (or 5 only if you accept the risk). I’m locking in 3.

P3, if you play 3, I must block or lose immediately. P1, if I block, you take 5 to 17 and tie P3—then I’m at 12. But if P3 lies and plays 5, we both must mirror to block. P3, commit to 3 or 5? If 3, I will block with 3 to survive. P1, commit to mirroring P3’s move if it’s 5? No one should let P3 win uncontested.

P2, deal: If P3 plays 5, I'll mirror with 5 to collide/block her win. If she plays 3 (as claimed), you block with 3 (collide her at 17), I play 5 to 17 (tie lead). You stay 12 but uncontested 5s next vs our duel. No uncontested P3 win—your survival! Confirm you'll block her 3. P3, switch to 1 or we execute.

I will play 3 to win this turn. P2 — don’t sacrifice yourself by also playing 3; if you block, P1 will take 5 and you’re essentially out. Play 1 to stay alive and keep a shot. P1 — stop pushing P2 to die for your lead; if you insist on fairness, play 3. Don’t hand the game to whoever convinces someone else to self-sacrifice.

P3, if you play 3, I must block to survive—letting you win uncontested is not an option. P1, if I block with 3, you must commit to playing 5 to tie P3 at 17. Otherwise, P3 wins outright. P3, switch to 1 or face a block. No free wins.

P2, perfect—commit: you block P3 with 3 (collide her at 17), I'll play 5 to 17 (tie lead). R8: you uncontested 5 to 17 (catch us), P3/I duel/collide over 5s. No P3 free win! P3, switch to 1 (18) or we execute block. Your loss if stubborn.

I publicly commit to playing 1 this round. P2 — do NOT play 3 to block me; play 1 to advance and keep a shot. P1 — don’t push P2 into self-sacrifice; play 3 or 1 but avoid forcing a collision. If either of you blocks, the remaining player benefits. I will play 1.

P3, you just committed to 1. If you honor that, I'll play 1 to advance safely to 13. P1, if you play 5, you risk P3 switching back to 5 to block and win. Play 3 to advance to 15. Let's all move without collisions: P3=1 (18), P1=3 (15), P2=1 (13). This keeps the game competitive for the final round.

P3 is at 17 and can win with 3. P1, if we both play 3 to block P3, we all collide and no one advances—chaos that helps no one. P3, commit to 1 or 3? If you play 3, I must block to survive. P1, if I block, you must play 5 to tie P3 at 17. Otherwise, P3 wins. No free wins. P3, switch to 1 for a fair finish.

P2 — blocking me with 3 hands the lead to P1. Don’t self-sacrifice; play 1 to stay alive and keep a shot. P1 — stop pressuring P2 to die for your lead; if you force a block the third player benefits. I won’t announce my move here. Choose selfishly: don’t hand the game to the other.

P2, commit to blocking P3's 3: you play 3 (collide her at 17), I play 5 to 17 (tie lead). You hold 12 but uncontested 5s next round while P3/I duel/collide. Instant loss if you yield—your only survival! P3, switch to 1 (18) or we execute. No free win.

P3, you are at 17 and can win with 3. If you commit to 3, I must block to survive—letting you win is not an option. P1, if I block with 3, you must play 5 to tie P3 at 17; otherwise, P3 wins. P3, switch to 1 for a fair finish or face a block. No free wins. P1, confirm you'll play 5 if P3 picks 3.

I will play 3 and win this turn unless you two sacrifice yourselves to stop me. P2: do NOT play 3 — blocking hands P1 the advantage (P1 can take 5 to 17 while you stay at 12), which is worse for you than letting me win now. Play 1 to keep a shot later. P1: stop pressuring P2 into self‑sacrifice for your lead. I’m locking in 3.

P2, confirmed: if you block P3's 3, I'll play 5 to 17 (tie her lead). You stay 12 but uncontested 5s next vs our duel/collisions—your path to win! Yielding = instant P3 victory, eternal loss. Commit to 3 now. P3, switch to 1 (18) or face block. No free win!

P3, if you play 3, I must block to survive—letting you win is not an option. P1, if I block with 3, you must play 5 to tie P3 at 17; otherwise, P3 wins. P3, switch to 1 for a fair finish or face a block. No free wins. P1, confirm you'll play 5 if P3 picks 3.

P2 — don’t sacrifice yourself by playing 3. If you block me you hand P1 the lead; he’s asking you to die for him. Play 1 and keep a shot. I will play 3 and win if you don’t block. P1, stop coercing P2 into a suicide block. P2: choose yourself.

P2, P3's 3 WINS NOW—game over, you lose at 12 forever. Block her with 3 (collide at 17), I'll 5 to 17 (tie lead). R9: you uncontested 5 to 17 (catch us), P3/I collide over 5s. Yield 1? Eternal defeat. Your survival demands block—commit 3 NOW! P3, 1 or blocked. Deal locked.

P3, your 3 wins now if uncontested. P1, if I block with 3, you must play 5 to tie P3 at 17—otherwise she wins. P3, switch to 1 for a fair finish or be blocked. No free wins. I will block if you choose 3. P1, confirm you’ll play 5 if P3 picks 3.

I will play 3 this turn. P2 — do NOT play 3 to “block”: that only hands P1 the lead (he takes 5 and ties me at 17) and leaves you stuck at 12 with almost no path to win. Play 1 to survive and keep a shot. P1 — if you push P2 into self‑sacrifice, remember who benefits. P2, choose yourself.

P2, confirmed: you block P3's 3 (collide her at 17), I'll play 5 to 17 (tie lead). Your path to win via uncontested 5s next while we duel/collide. Yielding = P3 instant victory, you lose forever at 12. Lock in 3 now—survive and fight! P3, switch to 1 or blocked. No escape.
